BryanCutler commented on pull request #5229: ARROW-6315: [Java] Make change to ensure flatbuffer reads are aligned
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5229#discussion_r320524212
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/ipc/message/MessageSerializer.java
 ##########
 @@ -317,7 +370,9 @@ public static ArrowRecordBatch deserializeRecordBatch(ReadChannel in, ArrowBlock
       throw new IOException("Unexpected end of input trying to read batch.");
     }
 
-    ArrowBuf metadataBuffer = buffer.slice(4, block.getMetadataLength() - 4);
+    int prefixSize = buffer.getInt(0) == IPC_CONTINUATION_TOKEN ? 8 : 4;
 
 Review comment:

-      int messageLength = MessageSerializer.bytesToInt(buffer.array());

tianchen92 commented on pull request #5229: ARROW-6315: [Java] Make change to ensure flatbuffer reads are aligned
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5229#discussion_r320553806
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/ipc/message/MessageSerializer.java
 ##########
 @@ -317,7 +370,9 @@ public static ArrowRecordBatch deserializeRecordBatch(ReadChannel in, ArrowBlock
       throw new IOException("Unexpected end of input trying to read batch.");
     }
 
-    ArrowBuf metadataBuffer = buffer.slice(4, block.getMetadataLength() - 4);
+    int prefixSize = buffer.getInt(0) == IPC_CONTINUATION_TOKEN ? 8 : 4;
 
 Review comment:
   I believe the buffer contains both the continues and length, and it call slice to get metadataBuffer(in original the prefixSize==4):
   >ArrowBuf metadataBuffer = buffer.slice(prefixSize, block.getMetadataLength() - prefixSize);
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

tianchen92 commented on pull request #5229: ARROW-6315: [Java] Make change to ensure flatbuffer reads are aligned
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5229#discussion_r320554209
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/ipc/message/MessageSerializer.java
 ##########
 @@ -584,7 +653,18 @@ public static MessageMetadataResult readMessage(ReadChannel in) throws IOExcepti
     // Read the message size. There is an i32 little endian prefix.
     ByteBuffer buffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(4);
     if (in.readFully(buffer) == 4) {
-      int messageLength = MessageSerializer.bytesToInt(buffer.array());
+
+      int continuation = MessageSerializer.bytesToInt(buffer.array());
+      int messageLength = 0;
 
 Review comment:
   I think this is for the back compatible purpose, new format contains "continues + length", but old format only contains "length", so we first try to read first 4 byte, if it equals to -1, it's new format, we then read length, otherwise is old format and length = first 4 bytes value.
